intro: Codonanthe uleana, commonly known as the Uleana orchid, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to tree branches in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), aiding in water retention in its natural habitat. The flowers, which can be white, yellow, or orange, are often pollinated by bees and other insects.
